metadata.titel_preek: Philadelphia: The Keepers Are Kept, Part 2

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: A covenantal exchange where the believer's act of 'keeping the word' triggers God's reciprocal act of 'keeping the believer' from the hour of trial.

tekstueel_bewijs: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience
If you will diligently hearken unto my word
hold that fast which thou hast

object.identificatie: Divine Preservation / The Crown / Pillar status
tekstueel_bewijs: I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation
that no man take thy crown
I will make a pillar in the temple of my God
the Lord Jesus is offering his pledge in exchange for an action by his followers
God said to him, I will bless thee
I will write upon him the name of my God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who must perform the condition to become the Receiver.

tekstueel_bewijs: He's given to you and me the power to make a covenant
he's given to us the freedom of choice
helper.rol_van_god: God is the rewarder/responder, but the 'power' is described as an innate human capacity to choose.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is elevated to a global, apocalyptic 'Great Tribulation' and social decay.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical requirement to 'take God seriously' and avoid 'mistakes' in interpersonal dealings.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests that taking oneself seriously is a prerequisite for taking God seriously, which is the condition for the covenant.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Freedom of Choice → Believer ← Great Tribulation
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Believer → Keeping the Word → Divine Protection

voorbeelden_mens_subject: If you commit yourself to hell
we do not take God seriously

voorbeelden: hold that fast which thou hast
we ought to take seriously what God has said
If you want to be blessed
If somebody insists on going to hell
I do not know what the Lord's new name is
He's given to you and me the power to make a covenant

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the human will (Vouloir) and the inherent capacity (Pouvoir) to choose the covenant.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The movement is from S2 (Tribulation) to ~S2 (Human Keeping) in order to reach S1 (Divine Keeping).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is conditional: God keeps those who keep Him.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'hour of temptation' is treated as a terrifying cosmic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language, the underlying actantial structure is synergistic and conditional. God's action is a reaction to human performance ('Because thou hast kept... I also will keep').

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord Jesus is offering his pledge in exchange for an action by his followers.
If you commit yourself to hell... is it not presumptuous of God to violate your freedom?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I see no reference to extent, limitation, exceptions, qualifications. 'I will keep thee.'

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham is used as the model of the 'investing' believer.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who credited righteousness to Abraham; God is the one who stood in the fire.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety regarding whether they have 'kept the word' sufficiently to earn the 'keeping'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a bilateral contract rather than a unilateral gift.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon fluctuates between 'unconditional' sounding promises ('I will keep thee') and the strict conditional 'Because' of the text.
spanning_punten: The claim that there are no 'qualifications' to 'I will keep thee' contradicts the earlier statement that it is an 'exchange for an action'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord Jesus is offering his pledge in exchange for an action.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'power' to choose is treated as a natural human faculty rather than a gift of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'irresponsibility' or 'not taking God seriously' rather than total depravity.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (must hold fast) and God (will then keep).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a contract-briefing where the hearer is the primary Subject of the 'keeping' action.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The believer is the subject of 'keeping the word' as a condition for God's grace.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ as the Subject who kept the Word perfectly on behalf of the Philadelphians.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because Christ kept the word of patience for you, you are kept in Him.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Pillar' (Object/Receiver) being built by the Master Builder.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the passive verbs in the latter half of the text (I will make, I will write).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that God gives the 'keeping' power to the weak church.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already cosmic; the issue is the Subject's adequacy to face it.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (keeping the word) precedes Soteriology (being kept).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God keeps us (Soteriology), which enables us to hold fast (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The rhetorical power is strong, but the semiotic engine is driving toward a 'salvation by contract' that may burden the weary soul.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is encouraging; semiotically, it is a heavy burden of conditions.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Philadelphia; Greimas reveals the 'Covenant' is being used as a 'Contract' logic.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Freedom of Choice' is functioning as the 'Helper' actant, displacing the Holy Spirit.

appendices.notities: The sermon's definition of 'Covenant' as 'Contract' is the semiotic key to its moralistic structure.
